Edson did heed the testimony, as he thought, but by fitting up his boat he incurred debts. This placed him at a great disadvantage and in an 


                                       -263- 

embarrassing situation, which the Lord did not want him to occupy. . . . Those who ought to have shown sympathy would give him no words of encouragement--Ms 154, 1899, p. 7. (General manuscript "Restitution Due to the Southern Field," typed Nov. 18, 1899.)
